post.title: Replicator
post.contents:
# Replicator

An abstraction which, once instantiated physically, tends to cause itself to remain so by contributing to its copying[^1]. Examples of replicators are: ideas or [meme]s (the golden rule), genes (outrun predators).

Computer programs can also be replicators, as programs that solve a particular problem well get talked about and therefore copied.

[^1]: Hackethal, A Window on Intelligence: The Philosophy of People, Software, and Evolution â€“ and Its Implications, Chapter 1.

[meme]: ./meme.md

inboundLinks.context: Evolution is the creation of knowledge through alternating variation and selection. It is fundamentally the theory of abstract **replicator**s.
